newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Altera up, Atmel off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Altera up, Atmel off.

text.p: News of strong quarterly results and a Merrill Lynch upgrade sustained a climb in Altera Corp's stock price ahead of Thursday's market open.
Before the opening bell, Altera shares traded at 56, up 2-1/8 from Tuesday's close and in-line with last night's after-hours price.

The computer chip maker said third quarter earnings were $0.52 a share, up from $0.51 in the year-ago period and noted excess chip inventories have fallen sharply while orders and backlog increased in the last quarter.
This morning, Merrill Lynch raised is recommendation on the stock to near-term accumulate from neutral and the long-term rating was unchanged at accumulate.
Meanwhile, Atmel Corp shares suffered under heavy selling touched off by a forecast of flat fourth quarter revenues and profits versus the third quarter.
Before the market open, Atmel fell as low as 30-7/8 from 34-1/8, then rose to 31.
Along with the warning, Atmel reported third quarter earnings of $0.53 per share.
Traders said they expected shares in General Electric to rise on news of robust quarterly results. GE shares closed yesterday at 92-7/8.

They also said Olin Corp shares were seen gaining at the market open after the company said it will spin off its ordnance and aerospace divisions, sell several chemical operations, split its stock and start a share repurchase program.
Sunglass Hut stock fell to 10-3/4 from 13-1/2 following the company's announcement of a third quarter earnings warning and a Morgan Stanley downgrade to neutral from outperform.

Also, Broderbund shares fell 1/8 to 24 after reporting below-expectation quarterly earnings and Dell Computer dropped to 82-1/2 from 84-3/8 following a Prudential Securities downgrade to hold from buy, traders said.
